Read in the file `kidsfeet.csv`.  For each of the following, hand
in the R statements to find what is asked for.  Provide both the
command you give and the output of the command.



#. The names of the variables.YOUR ANSWER HERE.itemname=names]

#. The mean of the foot `width` variable.YOUR ANSWER HERE.itemname=width]

#.  Which of the cases are girls.YOUR ANSWER HERE.itemname=girls]

#.  The mean foot `width` for the subset of data for the
  girls.YOUR ANSWER HERE.itemname=girlfeet]




Of no particular statistical value, but to review the use of logical
operators: 




#. The mean foot `width` for the subset of data for people
whose bigger foot is left and dominant hand is also left.YOUR ANSWER HERE.


And, for some extra practice in using logical operators:



#. The mean foot `width` for the subset of data for people
who are either male or whose bigger foot matches the dominant hand. 
YOUR ANSWER HERE.
#. The mean foot `width` for the subset of data for people
whose bigger foot does NOT match the dominant hand.YOUR ANSWER HERE.
